data.enText: a group of words whose meaning is different from the meanings of the individual words

data.chText: “让猫从袋子里跑出来”是惯用语，意思是无意中泄露秘密。
data.enText: ‘Let the cat out of the bag’ is an idiom meaning to tell a secret by mistake.

data.chText: （某时期或某地区的人的）语言和语法
data.enText: the kind of language and grammar used by particular people at a particular time or place

data.chText: （写作、音乐、艺术等的）典型风格
data.enText: the style of writing, music, art, etc. that is typical of a particular person, group, period or place

data.chText: 古典 / 当代 / 通俗风格
data.enText: the classical/contemporary/popular idiom

data.chText: 以上各词均为表达意思的语言单位。
data.enText: These are all words for a unit of language used to express sth.
word
a single unit of language which means sth and can be spoken or written
Do not write more than 200 words.
He uses a lot of long words.
term
( rather formal ) a word or phrase used as the name of sth, especially one connected with a particular type of language
technical/legal/scientific terms
‘Old man’ is a slang term for ‘father’.
phrase
a group of words which have a particular meaning when used together

data.chText: 谁创造了desktop publishing（桌面出版）这个词组？
data.enText: Who coined the phrase ‘desktop publishing’?

data.chText: 在语法上，phrase指不含限定动词、构成句子一部分的短语、词组，如the green car和on Friday morning均为词组。
data.enText: In grammar, a phrase is a group of words without a finite verb, especially one that forms part of a sentence: ‘the green car’ and ‘on Friday morning’ are phrases.
expression
a word or phrase

data.chText: 他往往用许多我以前从未听说过的俚语。
data.enText: He tends to use a lot of slang expressions that I've never heard before.
idiom
a group of words whose meaning is different from the meanings of the individual words

data.chText: let the cat out of the bag（让猫从袋子里跑出来）为成语，意为无意中泄露秘密。
data.enText: ‘Let the cat out of the bag’ is an idiom meaning to tell a secret by mistake.
a new word/term/phrase/expression/idiom
a(n) technical/colloquial/idiomatic/slang word/term/phrase/expression
to use a(n) word/term/phrase/expression/idiom
to coin a(n) word/term/phrase/expression
a(n) word/term/phrase/expression/idiom means sth
a word/term for sth

simple_means.memory_skill: idio 特殊的；个人的 + m → 个人经常说的话 → 惯用语

means: (某时期或某地区的人的)语言和语法
(写作、音乐、艺术等的)典型风格

tr: the style of a particular artist or school or movement
a manner of speaking that is natural to native speakers of a language
an expression whose meanings cannot be inferred from the meanings of the words that make it up
the usage or vocabulary that is characteristic of a specific group of people
example: the immigrants spoke an odd dialect of English
he has a strong German accent
it has been said that a language is a dialect with an army and navy

value.def: A particular idiom is a particular style of something such as music, dance, or architecture.

example.ex: McCartney was also keen to write in a classical idiom, rather than a pop one...
example.tran: 麦卡特尼也热衷于古典风格而不是通俗风格的创作。

example.ex: It was an old building in the local idiom.
example.tran: 那是一座具有当地风格的古建筑。

value.def: An idiom is a group of words which have a different meaning when used together from the one they would have if you took the meaning of each word separately.

example.ex: Proverbs and idioms may become worn with overuse...
example.tran: 谚语和习语会由于使用过多而变得俗套。

example.ex: She is, in fact, a perfect illustration of the French idiom 'to be comfortable in one's own skin.'
example.tran: 实际上，她很好地诠释了“欣然接纳自我”这一法语习语的意思。

value.def: Idiom of a particular kind is the language that people use at a particular time or in a particular place.

example.ex: And nothing was so irritating as the confident way he used archaic idiom.
example.tran: 没什么比他使用过时的方言时那种自负的神态更气人的了。

trans: 英文成語；英语习语；习惯用语题英语习语；英文惯用语；英文成语
成语-钱；与钱有关的成语
成语原则；习语原则；惯用原则

rootsaffixes.indicate: = peculiar, private 特殊的；个人的
rootsaffixes.title: idio

partsOfSpeech.dec: idio 特殊的；个人的 + graph 写，图 → 个人专用的图 → 标记
idio 特殊的；个人的 + m → 个人经常说的话 → 惯用语
idiom 惯用语；成语 + atic 属于…的 → 惯用语的
idio 特殊的；个人的 + syn 共同 + crasy → 个人特殊行为 → 癖好
